column1: back of a length, slight shape away from the corridor, left alone
length ball on the pads, looks to swing it out from there, but this goes straight through. Tucked to fine leg off the front foot
full and slightly outside off, solidly behind to push it into the covers
back of a length outside off stump, no swing, skids through and takes the toe-end of the bat as he defends on the up
full, middle stump, brings the bat down straight and offers the full face as he defends
good length at middle stump, puts in a half stride and pokes this into the leg side with soft hands, beats mid-on for speed comfortably for the single

drops it marginally short of a length, and Mire is on top of this quickly. Drags it from outside off stump and pulls past square leg. Gets it off the sticker, but this rolls away as mid-on joins the chase
full at off stump, defended back down the pitch. Very late on that, no feet
crunched. Short and wide outside off stump, doesn't quite climb on him, but it's nicely in the slot and he only has to get a swing at this. Through the line, on the up, through cover point
back of a length in the corridor, covers the line and taps it towards point with soft hands. Direct hit on the diving underarm flick, but Mire was in
good length, angled in at off stump, defended into the leg side with the angle
good length, nips back in from outside off, defended off the back foot
nice big stride, cuts out the marginal swing, defends this length ball to mid-off

good length, looks like he's rolled his fingers on this delivery just outside off. Another big stride and he pushes on the up to mid-on's left. The fielder dives and parries it to mid-off, gets back up on his feet and finds the umpire's got his hand stretched out to signal no-ball
offcutter, floated full at off stump. He waits in his crease but cannot time this drive across the line. Just a single to mid-on
good length, outside off stump, solidly defended off the front foot
oh beautiful. He's showing the face nicely today. This time, the front foot gets him to the pitch at middle stump, and he punches it past mid-on who can't put in a dive this time
good length at leg stump, defended off the front foot
length ball down the leg side, shovelled on the up to fine leg
back of a length, angled into off stump, pushed on the up to mid-on
back of a length in the channel, draws him forward and induces the inside edge. It thuds into the pads and drops in front of the keeper
loud appeal but this is going down leg. Pacey, and strikes him hard on the front leg in front of leg stump
back of a length, middle stump, pushed to square leg on the up
overpitched on off stump, gets the stride in, mistimes the drive to mid-off
shot. Back of a length in the corridor, doesn't climb, but it doesn't need to. He's quickly behind to whip this over midwicket
loose from Malinga. Gives him a lot of width outside off, length ball, and he just has to connect on the slash to get a four to the cover boundary
good length at off stump, solid on the front foot again, defended
bouncer. First one of the day. It's on leg stump, Masakadza ducks it comfortably
short on leg stump, uses his front foot press to spring up for the bounce, and pull this off his hips. Finds the square leg boundary
goes for the bouncer. Leg stump stump again and it flies down leg side...not called a wide
offcutter, good length outside off stump. Doesn't get to the pitch as he whips this using his wrists. It's aerial for a bit, but safely in front of mid-on who tumbles to his right as he fields
full and angled into off stump, defended to mid-on with a full face

another loud appeal. This one looks closer than the previous one. Good length ball, nips in sharply as he's delivered it from wide of the crease. Strikes him on the leg in front of middle stump. It looked a tad high though. Mathews says no to the review
nicely timed, but straight to mid-off. Wide of the crease from Pradeep again, length ball bunted on the up

this one isn't nicely timed, but it's good enough to beat mid-on. Anticipating the angle into him now. Picks this length ball from outside off, swats across the line with a turning bat, gets the result
short and wide, but with the angle in. Craps him at the last moment as he cuts, beaten
good length, angled into the pads, defended on the up to mid-on
oh gets away. Short and wide, deserved to be put away, but Masakadza late on the cut and too far under the ball

full at off stump, looks to punch this past mid-on but gets the timing wrong. Hits the inside half of the bat and bounces a couple of times before finding Malinga's laboured dive to his left at mid-on
overpitched on leg stump, misses out on the flick. Only the bowler appeals. That was going down
loose shot. Missed three boundary opportunities this over, he must feel. Tries to club this length ball outside off through the covers, beaten
thuds him on the pad again. Chameera's brought in a slight increase in pace, and it's helping him get away with indiscipline. This was another full one on the pad, and he can't get the flick away
finally connects. Full, outside off stump, throws his hands at it. Slams it into the turf and bounces it over extra cover
good length, middle stump, pushed to mid-on on the up
nearly takes off stump. Length ball delivered from wide of the crease, doesn't climb at all. Skids through at shin height as he tries to swing across the line
there it is. Gets it right up to the batsman, keeps his line and angle intact. No feet from Mire once more. Plays with an angled bat and he's struck right in front of middle and off. Plumb in front.
oh nearly gets him out lbw as well. Good length, 140kph, nips it in and raps the pads in front off off stump. But there was an inside edge first
founds some rhythm, has Pradeep. Gets this to climb from a length and hit the body as the batsman looks to defend this outside off
good length outside off, anxious defence to mid-off on the up
glorious. Good length outside off stump. A decent delivery, but he's used the stride so well to get to that. Lovely balance as he dispatches this through wide mid-off on the up
back of a length outside off stump, left alone
mistimed and skewed, but past mid-on. Full into off stump, the bat turns as he goes for the big drive. That pace is troubling him still
back of a length outside off stump, on top of the bounce, punched to mid-off
good shot. Middles the on-drive, finds Malinga
back of a length in the corridor, watches it closely and taps it late to get it past backward point
oh, yes. Pradeep is danger right now. Wide of the crease, hits a length in the corridor, gets it to straighten and climb to take the glove on that forward defence
back of a length at off stump, defended on the up
delicious. Masakadza won't be bowled to. He knows the angle. Puts a half-stride across, picks this from outside off and lifts it over mid-on with some arrogance
good length at middle stump, defended into the leg side off the front foot
back of a length outside off stump, stands tall, opens the face and runs it to third man...they nearly collide on the run
good length at off stump, half-stride forward to defend into the off side
tossed up at leg stump, leans in, drives to long-on
drops it short outside off stump, gets smoked. Quickly onto the back foot and this is hammered past midwicket
back of a length outside off stump, pushed to mid-off, back foot
short and wide this time, chopped out to sweeper cover
short at middle stump, back foot punch to long-on
wrong'un, dropped very very short. It's outside off stump as he reaches for it and drags it from ankle height. Gets it past midwicket and wide of long-on
shot. Tad short outside off stump, expansive cut right off the meat of the bat. But point is on the boundary, it's only one
full at off stump, pushed off the bottom of the bat - no feet - straight to mid-off
Not. A. Clue. Short of a length, pitches outside off stump, climbs sharply at his shoulder and he's stuck halfway between a pull and a duck. Cops it on his left bicep
oh he's nervous. Camps on the back foot, gets a short one into the body, fends at it with one hand
back and across early, rides the bounce this time, and tickles it to fine leg
full and wide outside off stump, sliced on the up, past point and way to the left of sweeper cover
good length, looped outside off stump, front foot defence
gives it air again. 78kph. Good length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket
pushes it through, back of a length on middle stump. Mistimed pull to midwicket
gives it air again, but it's back of a length. It's the wrong'un. He looks to flick this into the leg side and nearly returns a catch off the leading edge
short and wide, another wrong'un, too wide
back of a length on off stump, punched with the turn, back towards the bowler
short at leg stump, pushed through quickly. He's back in the crease for the pull, but can't get connection on it. Not with bat anyway
full outside off stump, driven off the bottom of the bat to mid-off
good shot. Short and just outside off stump, rides the bounce, keeps the pull down to deep square leg
good length outside off stump, shuffles across and defends into the off side off the front foot
shuffles across, gets in a good position to face this bouncer. Nails the pull shot from off stump, finds deep square leg
slower ball, just wide of off stump on a good length. Opens up his arms to drive through the line, but he's well beaten
short, wide, sits up. The ball, that is. Masakadza springs above it, gets his hands free and places this past point
floated up, full on middle stump, front leg out of the way to dig it out to long-on
good length at leg stump, gets his front leg across and paddles this fine. Long leg has a lot of distance to cover, can't keep it to a single
slow, back of a length at middle stump, pushed into the leg side off the back foot

full at leg stump, gets low and paddles this too. Connects too well, it'll only be a single but that's his fifty. He would've raised his bat, but he's dropped it on the pitch while running. Streak chuckles in the dressing room
full at middle stump, driven to long-on
back of a length outside off stump. Down early for the sweep. He knew where he wanted to hit that. Adjusts for the bounce and hits it into the floor, straight to long leg
short at leg stump, stands tall and uses the angle to pull this. Aerially. One bounce, to fine leg
back of a length outside off stump, stabs at it, gets it down to third man
back of a length outside off stump, punched on the up to extra cover
awww yessssss. The perfect hook shot. Picks the length early, watches it onto the bat, and rolls the wrist beautifully to find the gap to deep square's right
follows it up with a lovely cover drive. Not too much feet, but this was in the slot. Extra cover leaps to his right to deny a boundary
good length outside off stump, not great connection on this drive, but it trickles past cover
tossed up delivery on leg stump, Musakanda attempts a lap sweep, but misses
too short, and Musakanda powers it away through extra cover. There doesn't seem to be much turn for the left-arm wristpinner, and perhaps he's struggling bowling into the wind too. Losing his length.
tosses it up, now from around the wicket, Musakanda drives to short cover
this new angle might just favour Zimbabwe's preferred ploy - the stock ball is spinning into the right-hander, and angled into him too. Musakanda plays a deft little lap sweep

back over the wicket to Masakadza, and he still cops it! Overpitched this time from Sandakan and Masakadza unleashes his considerable power. Straight down the ground, and if that ball can talk, it'd be cussing in pain

almost does him with the wrong 'un. Perfect length there, coupled with the flight to draw the batsman forward, a batsman who thinks this is turning into him. Masakadza uses half a bat, looking for midwicket. The ball rags past the outside edge.
and perhaps karma is catching up to him. Starts with a terribly short ball and Musakanda hangs back and pummels it over midwicket
quicker delivery, on off stump, moving in with the angle, or rather with lack of turn. Musakanda, because of the ball being fuller, is unsure what to play and gets an inside edge
tries a sweep, but that doesn't work either
shortish and outside off, cuts it past point
slinks back in his crease and carves a shortish delivery to backward point
now the reverse sweep, which goes well in front of square, to the sweeper to bring up the hundred
starts from around the wicket, for a good length ball on off stump. Masakadza defends with an open face to point
defends a fuller delivery on leg stump. That'll be his plan. Tucking Masakadza up, never giving him room. Plenty of singles on offer though.
going for the lap sweep, and so hitting right across the line. Good length ball hits low on the pad, but would have carried past the off stump
nudges a length ball on leg stump to short midwicket. Masakadza bats with hard hands. That doesn't always work with a bowler like Gunaratne
that big backlift winds up, but this is a slower ball, and so he has to adjust. Doesn't swing towards midwicket as he was originally looking for and instead chips it over mid-off
sweeps to long leg to keep strike
gets it past the left of point. He's rollicking along, and he's bold enough to keep trusting these awkward shots. Sees a full ball on leg stump and meets it on the full with a reverse sweep
all power! And so eager is he to show it off that he runs down the track, turns a flighted ball into a full toss and nails it to the long-on boundary. There was a man in the deep, he has no chance
tosses it up on leg stump, so much that it becomes a yorker. Masakadza digs it out
stays beside the flighted ball on middle and leg and drives to the left of mid-off. Good running
gets forward to block a flighted delivery on off stump, might well have been the googly
excellent cricket, he spots the flight on the ball, and the line being outside off, gets low with it and presents a dainty little reverse sweep past backward point's left
rocks back and cuts to short cover
good length ball outside off, Masakadza blocks to point
full on off stump, drills it down to long-off, trying to hit his way out of trouble. But handling Gunaratne might be easier with softer hands
like that. Musakanda tries to tickle a length ball on the pads, gently, towards square leg. Plays a touch too gently that time
launches it over wide long-on! That is sensational! He has the fielder in the deep to contend with, and perhaps a bit more problematic would have been the howling wind.
drives a full delivery down the ground, Gunaratne does well in his followthrough, reaching to his left from around the wicket
starts with the offcutter, which is tapped down to long-on, for, would you believe it, two! Musakanda, you little beauty. He makes his senior partner suck it up and run
low full toss on off stump, Maskadza pushes it to Mendis, three feet to the right of the pitch
singes the blockhole, but Masakadza squeezes it out to cover
full and outside off, drives fluently through to deep cover
whips one from the base of off stump to mid-on, hitting slightly across the line

he keeps looking for the blockhole, and this one becomes a full toss, wobbling away onto leg stump. Musakanda does the needful. Kindly points it to the long leg boundary and sends it on its way on a very happy journey
the reverse sweep, possibly premeditated, with the angle of the ball going across him. Gets a little top edge through to deep third man
and the other guy goes sweep - to a very full ball on off stump - and he just about brings his bat down in time to get an inside edge through midwicket

that is sooo lovely! For all the cuteness of playing the horizontal bat shots, this is so much more effective. Races down the track and launches a length ball right over mid-off. Hits the rope on the full and that brings up the 100-partnership.
loopy delivery - brave of him to toss it up - Masakadza drives to long-off. He's into the 90s!
stays back, and with the length being short, he is able to read the googly off the pitch and slice it to point
rocks back and cuts the short wrong 'un through to deep point
full on off stump, pushes it to long-on
full on off stump, pushes to the left of mid-off
works it to the left of short midwicket, making sure the bat face is straight to find the single
slower ball, becomes a full toss, which swerves and dips in the air. Musakanda, manages to wait on it, get low and clip it to deep square leg

if that's straight onto boot, he's gone lbw, but umpire Gould disagrees. So Mathews opts fora review. Pretty awesome ball, to start things off. A yorker, that reverses into the right-hander, so very late. Said right-hander plays all around it, and might live to do the same again if he has got an inside edge on this. Oh, actually, the swing might well take it down leg. There appears to be no bat. The thing going for Malinga though is it hits the toe on the flush - so from there the ball-tracking will have to go on a straight line. Third umpire Nigel Llong has a decision to make. Hawk-Eye says it's only clipping leg stump, so the one-field umpire's call stands. Not out. And Sri Lanka lose their review

pierces the field on the off side. A fine drive to the left of mid-off, the perfect response to something close to a half-volley. Angelo Mathews chases it down, and kind of slips on the boundary as he turns to throw
full on off stump, Musakanda plants his front foot forward and blocks

huge appeal for the lbw, but the umpire reckons its pitched outside leg. Musakanda plays back to a good length ball and it surprises him by zipping through and pinning him on the knee roll in front of leg stump. While the appeal goes out, Masakadza pinches the leg bye.
seems to pick the wrong 'un as he goes back and punches with a straight bat to cover

gets it past backward point. The lack of turn, and the angle across him from over the wicket is helping this shot. Good batting. Not looking to hit it too hard, just making sure he gets good contact, and the placement
googly, reads it again as he goes back, opens the face and gets a single to the sweeper
full on off stump, Musakanda drives, but finds no runs as Sandakan dives to his left and grabs the ball with his strong hand
drifts down leg - a full toss. Masakadza attempts a glance but misses as the wind howls away. It's actually audible off the stump mic
brings down a straight bat to handle a reverse swinging yorker on off stump
dabs the shortish delivery to the right of point
looks for the full delivery on middle and leg, looking to make Musakanda play across the line and fall over himself, which he does. Ball pings off the pad to short midwicket
full toss on off stump, lifts it to the right of long-on where Chameera puts in a good effort, diving to his right to stop the boundary
looks for the leg-stump yorker, Musakanda doesn't get bat to it, but is happy to get his team a leg-bye

there it is! With a flick to long leg comes up a hundred for Hamilton! Goes through for the second run and then clutches the Zimbabwe crest on his chest and looks at the dressing room, soaked in pride. It's his fifth ODI hundred, and his first against a team other than Kenya, Afghanistan and Bangladesh
tosses it up on off stump, defends
works a full ball back down the pitch
backs away to try and open up the off side, but Gunaratne follows him. Without the room he thought he would have, Musakanda picks out short cover

heaves it into the wind.... and straight to long-on! He had a fifty for the taking, but in going for quick runs, in trying to keep Sri Lanka under the pump, he's given his wicket away. Good innings - in that he didn't look good at the start, but gutsed it out - comes to an end
full on middle and leg, Masakadza goes inside out with a drive to cover
full on off stump, defends, and that's the end of another wicket-maiden
that's grand, a 142 kph delivery, pitches on a good length and darts away past the outside edge, with the angle across the left-hander. Very little footwork
blocks a full delivery on middle and off. It's 140 kph this time
full and outside off, Ervine throws his bat at it and comes up with nothing.
full and outside off at 143 kph, Ervine sends it to short cover
pushes it down the ground, between the non-striker and the stumps for a single
shortish on off stump, eases it to short third man

lovely drive. People with good hands can handle Gunaratne, and here Ervine shows how, leaning forward to the half-volley and breaking his wrists to make sure he gets the gap between short cover and mid-off
nudges a ball off middle and leg through to long-on
full and outside off, Masakadza lashes it to a wide long-off
full on off stump, drives to mid-off
punches a shortish delivery down to long-on
full on middle stump, Masakadza digs it out
full on off stump, drives to mid-off

another ripper. The seam is presented upright, the ball is angled across the left-hander, and the wind helps it move past the outside edge as well. Ervine, not moving his feet when the length is good, isn't helping
that's better, a good, long stride forward helps him smack the length delivery past short cover's right
again, nicely forward, with an open face to slice the back of a length ball through to the sweeper
legcutter on off stump, blocks into the covers for a single
pins him on the pad with a 140 kph delivery that seems to hold its line. Ervine is late into his flick and survives because it might have pitched outside leg.
fuller delivery on off stump, defends

premeditates the reverse sweep, but by making sure he doesn't try to overhit, and by keeping his eyes on the ball always, he picks the gap to the left of backward point. That's hard to do to drag that ball from way outside leg
clips a shortish delivery away through square leg
rocks back and cuts a short delivery to deep point
works a short delivery off his hips to deep midwicket
full on middle, defends.
full and tailing in at leg stump, comfortably pushed to short mid-on
good length, cramps him in the mid-riff, pushed to midwicket feebly
goes for the bouncer but it is too short. Flies a couple of yards over the batsman
short and wide outside off stump, places the cut to sweeper's left, lazy passage of play, brings two
good length at off stump, short stride forward to push and steal a single to mid-off
short and wide outside off stump, chops it straight to point. Hasn't looked so confident till this point
short and angled across off stump, gets behind the line and cuts into the turf to get it over point but sweeper cover runs to his right and parries it back in

finds deep square leg with a lofted sweep. The shot was on. It was full, it was at middle stump, and there was a big gap behind square on the leg side. He took it on, like a man on 111 should. But Pradeep ran nicely to his right, most of it backwards, and composed himself nicely to hold on
tossed up at middle stump, driven down the ground, to long-on
tossed up at middle stump, driven back at the bowler...who misfields, but recovers quickly to stop the single
flighted full outside off stump, toe-ended drive, straight to mid-off
good length outside off stump, stretches forward and pokes it to point's left to get off the mark

big lbw shout but not out says the umpire. Full delivery strikes him in front of leg stump. Wanidu hasn't been turning the ball too much so there's a very small chance it could be spinning down. Not out says the umpire. It might have pitched outside in any case
good length, drifted in at a good length outside off stump, pushed through the covers off the front foot
flighted at off stump, taken on the full, driven to long-off
back of a length outside off stump, enough time to hang back and slap it to sweeper
good length outside off stump but that is so slow and so loopy, he can punch off the back foot. Mistimes it. Extra cover cleans up

full at off stump, reaches the pitch and drives to extra cover...who can't hold on to his right and just deflects it in the end. Into an awkward region behind him at an awkward pace that teases a lot of fielders but allows two
how did that miss?! Drifts this in on a good length, it pitches on middle and off and spins away, past the outside edge and inches away from the off stump
pushed down leg side, full. He looks to flick and loses balance, but the keeper can't get low enough to stop that very difficult ball
shapes like for the reverse sweep, watches the full ball onto his bat at leg stump and tickles it past short third man
takes another one on the full, and this time swats it away with the reverse sweep. It runs away quickly but once more, sweeper does well to slide to his right
full at middle stump, driven to long-on
full outside off stump, nicely middled drive, straight to mid-off

goes for the sweep and misses...and the umpire's given it! It strikes him on leg stump and it's very full. Doesn't look out on first glance but it's been given. They have reviewed. This looks like it has marginally pitched in line. It's a slider from the bowler, so it's not spinning down a long way. In slow-mo, I reckon it will be umpire's call. In fact, it's hitting leg stump comfortably. It's not called umpire's call, technically, but the umpire's call was perfect. Good decision.
oh and another close one. There's enough gap for another ground in the jungle as Waller drives away form his body. Ball slides through from a good length and nearly takes off stump
full at off stump, driven to extra cover
good length at off stump, pushed straight to extra cover off the front foot
ah poor ball. Dropped short at off stump, rocks back and slaps it over midwicket
back of a length outside off stump, under-edged cut to sweeper cover
flat, length, leg stump. Looks to flick it behind square, can't connect with bat
back of a length at leg stump, onto the back foot, punches back to the bowler
full at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
tossed up at off stump, gets to the pitch, squeezes it inside-out to sweeper
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
tossed up at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
pushed through flat outside off stump, leans into the push to power it past extra cover
back of a length at middle stump, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length, flat at middle stump, watchfully defended off the back foot
wrong'un at middle stump, too short. Easily turned off the back foot to deep square
full outside off stump, dug out, through the covers
good length, pitches outside leg stump and spins towards middle. Williams closes the face too early and gets a leading edge but it lands safely away from the bowler
good length outside off, pushed to extra cover off the front foot
drifted down leg, very floaty, very full, clipped off his toes to short fine
back of a length slider, into the pads, flicked to deep square
back of a length at leg stump, turned to deep midwicket on the up
good length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump, clipped across the line, midwicket dives to his left and saves the run
good length outside off stump, leans in and pushes it to sweeper cover

squeezes it past backward point and converts a tight over into a good one for the batting team. This was overpitched and angled across the batsman from around the wicket. He didn't quite get to the pitch and perhaps wanted to drive it hard, but opened the face at the last moment and found the gap between point and short third man
tossed up outside off stump, driven to long-off
good length at off stump, some spin back into the batsman who plays very late and tentatively pushes it to midwicket
good length, pitches on leg stump and turns down as he attempts to sweep. Dickwella appeals. Of course.
full at middle stump, defended into the leg side
good length outside off stump, goes forward and drops it into the covers
dropped short outside off stump, cut straight to sweeper cover
good length outside off stump, defended back down the pitch
tossed up at middle stump, driven to long-on
back of a length and angled across off stump, punched on the up to sweeper cover
good length, drifted in outside off stump, chopped off the back foot to sweeper cover
drops it short on the pads, but there's no power on the pull, long leg cleans up
good length at off stump, looks to close the face and gets a leading edge that runs past extra cover. Good pick up and throw but they make it
good length, angled across off stump, looks to open the face and push this past short third, but he's beaten
overpitched outside off stump, puts the front leg across and swipes at it with a reverse sweep. Cops it on the toe
good length at off stump, reverse sweep, can't find the gap. Short third man is there
floated up at off stump, gets to the pitch and drives to sweeper cover
full outside off stump, drives with the turn to long-on
googly, pitches full on middle stump and pings the pads as he looks to flick it behind square
back of a length at off stump, punched off the back foot to extra cover
oh this looks really good! Not out says the umpire. Good length, drifts in and thuds him in front of middle and off as he looks to sweep. Looked plumb to me
goes for the reverse sweep this time. Gets good bat on it after reaching the pitch outside off. Finds sweeper who is quite square
surely! Surely! Oh this looks even closer than the previous one. It's basically a yorker that he looks to sweep and misses again. Hits the back leg in front of middle stump.
good length at leg stump, pushed to long-on on the up
good length at leg stump, sweeps, top edges down to long leg
enough of the sweeping, he says. Steps out, reaches this loopy one at the pitch and bludgeons it down the ground. Straight to long-off

ouch! That'll give you some urgency. Williams steps down again, gets to the pitch outside off stump and absolutely wallops this...only to find his partner on the full at the other end. No casualties, thankfully.
lovely. Gets to the pitch outside off again, and this time he places it over his partner and beats long-off
length on the pads, reaches out and flicks to deep midwicket
back of a length at off stump, punched comfortably to sweeper cover
good length, pushed through flat at leg stump. Knew the batsman was coming down and adjusted his length. Good bowling, but he shovels this wide of long-on and gets the second
backs away, gets a nice overpitched ball on middle stump and chips it over the bowler. That is running away before long-on dives to his left to keep it in

and another big appeal as he misses the sweep. The right hander this time. Struck in front of middle stump. He's bowling from around so maybe that would have slid through and gone away from off. Or it might have pitched outside leg. Dead in front otherwise
pushes is through flat, and yorks him in front of middle as he steps out. Just about jams it out to long-on
full at leg stump, gets down, laps it to fine leg for a single

walks across the stumps, shows all of them and looks to ramps this fine. Questionable choice given Gunaratne's pace, but he's constantly been trying to hit him behind square. This is a good length ball and it crashes into the leg stump
oh, beauty. Teases him with a full one outside off stump, draws him into the drive and slides it past the outside edge. He just about manages to keep his back leg in the crease
back of a length at leg stump, tucked off his hips to long leg's left
reverse swingins yorker first up, aimed for the toes. He watches it very closely and tucks it fine before running back hard. Good cricket, made two against a good ball
low full toss on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
full outside off stump, looks to push through the off side, but Malinga's trajectory means this hits the inside half of the bat and rolls through the mid-on region
yorker, offcutter too. Slides down leg side though
full and swinging in towards leg stump, he wants to clip through midwicket, but it moves too quickly. Bunted back to the bowler
overpitched, tailing in at off stump. Digs it out to deep extra cover

rolls his fingers on the low full toss, gets it at middle stump. Waller walks across to try and flick this behind square. Misses big time. Full toss on the pads in front of middle stump and even in this match, that is out
back of a length at middle stump, pushed behind square off the back foot
back of a length outside off stump, goes deep in the crease and punches it wide of sweeper cover

pushed through at a length outside off...and he gets stunning connection on this. Seemed like an innocuous cover drive as he stretched for this, but he's got it past extra cover and racing away from the diving sweeper
...and going down leg. Good length, pitches on leg, turns further away, Dickwella does well
good length at middle stump, turns it to short fine with his wrists and takes a single
good length outside off stump, dropped to short third man with soft hands
premeditated reverse sweep. It's a full toss on leg stump. Might have been a better result without that shot, but it's a single to backward point and there's no changing that now
the perfect yorker, on off stump. Gets the bat down, it rolls into the leg side and gets one
yorker at leg stump this time, thuds him in the pad, it's a single in the point region
tailing full one on the leg side, low full toss in the end as he backs away, flicks to deep midwicket
overpitched outside off stump, and he's disappointed to miss out. Malinga's trajectory forced that. Brought down an angled bat and couldn't open up the off side
yorker on the toes, pushed straight to short midwicket

big, audacious swing at this, but he gets it off the toe. It's a length ball for the taking outside off and he puts a swing through this. Not great connection but mid-off is in. Another over spoiled by a last ball boundary
full on the pads, nicely connected sweep, straight to long leg
good length, in the slot for the slog sweep on middle stump. He takes the option, misses the ball.

wow. Superb. This is full and angled in at leg stump, but he gets under this so quickly  that he can bring his hands inside-out on it to make the connection and lift it over long-off. Classy, classy batting
creamed! This one is angled in at middle stump, and he gets all of the slog. Clobbers it with the spin, against the wind and over the midwicket boundary

can't beat the wind this time. He got good bat on this slog to an overpitched ball on leg stump. But you could see the ball struggling to travel. Hangs and hangs and hangs, then sits neatly in long-on's grasp

back of a length outside off, looks to push it it into the leg side but there isn't enough turn. It's pushed back down the pitch...and for some reason, Cremer has run down the pitch. Aimless. Sandakan picks up, runs back, and Cremer has to go for none off none
full at off stump, watches it closely and gets to the pitch to steal a single to mid-off and bring Raza on strike
backs away, gets followed, and the bowler misses the yorker. It's a juicy full toss and his hoick gets good connection. Bisects deep square and deep midwicket
misses length again on the attempted yorker. Low full toss on off stump, Raza has backed away again and drilled this through extra cover. Zimbabwe have 300
slower ball, back of a length outside off. Backs away and picks it, but he can't make enough power to cut this past sweeper cover
yorker at off stump, and once again he has his priorities right. Taps it pitch-side and runs like hell to bring Raza on strike

what a shot! Incredible stuff from Raza! He's somehow anticipated that slower ball and runs down the pitch. Meets it on the bounce just outside off stump and brings through such a sweet swing. Sends it sailing over long-on
heyoooooooo! Toldja this is going to be fun. And just to make sure it is, Mumba starts with a loosener. Short, wide, smashed through point
corrects his line - but back of a length appears his go to - as he keeps Dickwella to a defence
cramps him up with a shortish deliver that holds its line, and bounces above the midriff. Mumba, at his best with the new ball.
but the next ball dribbles down leg, with Dickwella's leg glance not quite the siren song as he would hope
gets up off his toes and clips the shortish delivery to short midwicket. Good bounce from the tall quick
opens the face and guides the back of a length ball to point
pitches it up, just as a change up, and Dickwella is rather reluctant in coming forward to block. Short man, perhaps worried about the short ball
nice zip through to the keeper as Chatara hits the deck and angles the ball across the left-hander. Gunathilaka leaves
full on off stump, blocks with soft hands to point

that's risky, but his timing makes it worth moving across onto off stump and hitting across the line of a wicket-to-wicket ball. Four past mid-on's left. That shot isn't entirely necessary at this stage, but it will put Gunathilaka in a good head space
moves across again, but with the length being fuller on off stump, he chooses to block
defends a pitched-up delivery on off stump, this time keeping his front foot from moving too far across
offers width and Gunathilaka accepts with great glee. Lunges forward to smoke the ball past mid-off's right.
lovely bowling. He finds a spot suitably full enough to tempt the drive from Dickwella but since it is still only the third over, the opener's feet aren't moving. And therefore he's beaten
pushes to the left of cover to pinch a single
hits high on the bat, and seems to square up the left-hander as Mumba hits the deck and angles a short ball across Gunathilaka
blocks a good length ball that aims for the top of off stump
swivels on the back foot and pulls it well in front of square leg. Shows how early he picks the length.
and again! He imitates a crazily revolving door and Mumba bowling short and at the body means the ball pings off the bat to the midwicket boundary again
full and outside off, slices it past point

there's not much of a gap between extra cover and cover, but he pierces it anyway, getting on the front foot and flaying his hands through the ball - a perfectly good length ball. And after taking a couple, he asks for some tape to be brought out for his bat, goes right round the middle.
oh, very well done. They are conscious of preventing Zimbabwe from building any pressure, this time, blocking down the pitch, with soft hands to pinch a single before mid-off could come up
exquisite! He has modelled some of his game around Dilshan, and like him plays some sumptuous shots. Half-volley on off stump, whipped over the top of midwicket
tentative poke outside off, the shortish length perturbing him
backs away to open up the off side, but the bowler follows him, disallowing him the chance to cut past point
shortish and outside off, cuts to cover
loops it up, nice and slow, on leg stump, Gunathilaka nudges to the left of mid-on
drifts down the pads, Dickwella tries to take advantage with a sweep, but has to settle for the extra
stays low as he pushes the good length ball through on off stump. Dickwella gets a bottom edge as he cuts
presses forward to block a flighted delivery on off stump
clips a full delivery on leg stump to square leg

nicely done! He lets the ball spin past him, and then dabs an angled bat down to secure a boundary to third man. This is a pretty fabulous start for Sri Lanka. Still only five overs though, so these two need to keep going
good length ball, holding its line outside off, Gunathilaka guides it to third man
there's the tribute to Dilshan! Steps forward, and down on one knee, and discoops the length ball on middle and off stump over fine leg. If he had missed, his helmet would have taken a pounding!

but it's an outside edge, which wanders away to the third man boundary! Mumba puts in a good effort, but can only parry it over. Tough luck on the bowler, who hits the length to pin the batsman in his crease, squares him up with a little seam movement, and still...
moves back to block a shortish delivery to cover
gently pats it to mid-on for a quick single. Sensible batting.

slower ball, good thinking from Chatara. Rolls his fingers across it and Gunathilaka is not ready for the offcutter. By the time he adjusts, the ball is ricocheting off his body and lands just in front of him
they're not keen on letting any bowler settle. Here Dickwella races down the track, doesn't get to the pitch, so resorts to a defensive push
nudges a full delivery on leg stump through midwicket
moves back to the flatter delivery on middle and clips it to the left of mid-on
fuller delivery on off stump, pushes to mid-on and they get the strike rotating again. Zimababwe, worried about the boundaries, have their fielders on the edge of the circle
works the shortish delivery through to deep square leg to bring up the team's fifty
presses forward to block a flighted delivery on leg stump
nudges it off his hips to long leg
a touch more bounce, which ensures Dickwella's clip goes off the glove to long leg rather than the middle of the bat to square leg
seems like an offcutter on middle, Dickwella works it to short midwicket
slower ball goes off target - wanders way outside off as Dickwella leaves
now that's definitely Jayasuriya! He stands up to a short ball and simply, by whirling his wrists, sends it one bounce to the square leg boundary
back of a length on off stump, blocks
too straight and Dickwella flicks it to long leg
fuller delivery on off stump, Dickwella tries to plant it at midwicket and run, but Raza gets across quickly
there's the single he wants, with a firmer push past the square to mid-on
nudges a length ball to the left of mid-on
low bounce for the second time off Raza's bowling. But Dickwella is just about able to get his bat down in time to pinch a single to midwicket
works it off the straight past mid-on
drives a full delivery to the right of the bowler
back over the wicket, for a shortish delivery that is turned to square leg
opens the face as he allows the back of the length ball to come to him and takes the single behind point
slower ball, and Gunathilaka, having set up to play it early, adjusts late enough to control his flick to long leg
slower ball, hangs it wide outside off, Dickwella drives to point

that's too easy. The ball is short on leg stump, so Dickwella shuffles across and glances it away to the long leg boundary. All that effort from  Chatara, working in the batsman's favour. That's gutting for a fast bowler
back of a length on off stump, defends with an open face behind point
leans over the tossed up delivery on off stump and manoeuvres it through midwicket
sees the flight and sets himself for a bottom-handed belt through the off side. The dip does him and he mistimes the shot down the pitch
whacks the shortish delivery through midwicket
gets down the track, hits the ball on the full, but finds mid-on.
flays the tossed up delivery to the sweeper cover
stays back to a length ball and works it with the angle to deep midwicket
goes off the bottom of the bat, but he has enough power to find the boundary. Length ball, very wide, a freebie really. So Gunathilaka frees his arms and swings straight down the ground
the dog's still around - and it nearly comes a little too close to a cricket ball coming a high pace. Dickwella cuts a short ball behind point and it just misses the poor creature
full on off stump, he gets low and drives the ball through to sweeper cover
blocks a good length ball on off stump - a slower one - which disallows the single to point
another slower ball, which finds short cover
flights it nicely onto middle, Dickwella directs it to short midwicket
drifts the ball over onto off stump, Dickwella plays against it, but with the turn, to deep square leg
shifts back against a good length ball, and with quick hands, is able to glance the ball to long leg. Had he missed it, he would have been bowled leg stump
seems like the googly, tossed up on off stump, Gunathilaka clips it to midwicket
keeper misses it down leg, that's sloppy. Good length ball, spins a touch more than both the batsman and Moor expected.
drags the length short and Gunathilaka pulls to deep square leg
hangs back to the shortish delivery and dabs it to the left of backward point, who does well, moving quickly and diving to keep it to a single

might just have fallen a touch short of the wicketkeeper! That said, Moor didn't really move as quickly as he should have. A dainty little leg glance, a little too dainty for Dickwella's comfort, goes for four
back of a length and outside off, glides it to backward point
reaches out, with no feet, at a length ball outside off and gets an inside edge towards fine leg
full on off stump, pushes to point
great work from backward point, leaping to his left and stopping a well timed slice
full and outside off, drives through the covers
fine shot to get to a fifty, getting down low, head over the line of the ball and hands flowing into the shot. Overpitched delivery dispatched with some class
takes the full toss on leg stump and sweeps it strongly to deep square leg
keeps to his crease, seeing the big floating delivery, and bullies it with his bottom hand. But for all that trouble, he only gets a single through midwicket. A single that brings up the hundred
nudges a length ball on leg stump behind square leg
blocks the googly, reading it only of the pitch, because he was, until the moment he presented a straight bat, looking to flick it through midwicket
lunges forward outside off to block
steps beside the offcutter, a shortish one too, and carves it to point

Zimbabwe are wondering if there's a glove in this pull shot through to the keeper. There's a long discussion, between the keeper, Raza and the captain, and it's taken too long. The 15 second window for asking a review passes. And it appears there was a little tickle! Umpire Martinesz didn't catch it. Neither did the fielding team
full on off stump, defends to point.
good length, banged in at middle stump, pushed to midwicket
close to the glove. Back of a length, climbing above off stump. Dickwella arches back to ramp this through the slip region, beaten
an offcutter, good length, outside off stump. Leans into the push, picks up a single to sweeper cover
in the air but far, far to the right of backward point. Regulation legspinner tossed up at off stump. Brings out the reverse sweep and top-edges it, but he's safe
good length on middle stump, front foot tuck to midwicket
good length on leg stump, gets down for the sweep, takes it on the body
oh man, how do you stop this guy? Full outside off stump and he's all balance on this occasion. Head still, elbow high, cover drive crunched to sweeper's left
pushed through at a length on leg stump, glanced to deep square
back of a length, pushed through again, outside off. Bunted out to sweeper cover
pushed through the flat on leg stump, back of a length, flicked off the back foot to deep square

dropped! Musakanda has put down a simple chance at point. Goes for the reverse sweep again, middles but slices it straight to point, Musakanda went for the reverse cup as he crouched. It was chest height but he lost balance halfway through the effort
good length at off stump, pushed to long-off
missed stumping. Gunathilaka overbalances on a length ball down leg, misses it, but so has Moor who is up too early
good length at leg stump, turned away to deep square
full at middle stump, poked to midwicket off the front foot
back of a length outside off, goes on the back foot but can't punch this past extra cover's drive
good length at middle stump, defended back down the pitch

shot. Goes deep in the crease and converts this into a short one. Punches from off stump and gives sweeper a lot of work to do...which he does. Parries it to long-off whose throw doesn't reach quickly enough. They take one on the relay
good length at leg stump, steps out, can't get to the pitch, fends at it
fends again at this. Doesn't get to the pitch at leg stump. This time it's a leading edge that lands in front of backward point
good length at off stump, drops it into the off side, hesitates...but his partner responds quickly and puts in a dive to complete the run
good length at leg stump, looks to steal a single in the midwicket region, hits it too well
good length at leg stump, pushed to midwicket off the front foot
full at leg stump, gets down the track and pushes back down the pitch...where the bowler was a moment ago. He's run to his left anticipating a push through there. Easy single then
good length, pitches outside leg, Moor's hand gets in the way as it spins
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
back of a length a length on the pads, looks to tickle it fine, takes it on the thigh guard
back of a length at leg stump, nurdled though midwicket off the back foot
good length at middle stump, down the track nicely and drives inside out to wide long-off
tossed up at middle stump, driven to mid-on against the turn, good running to top it off
oh shot. This is slaughtered through the extra cover area. Too much time given, bowling that short at him. Rocks back and pummels this punch to the extra cover boundary
good length at middle stump, blocked
good length at middle stump, front foot defence back down the pitch
full toss drifted into the pads, calmly flicked to deep midwicket to bring up his fifty
good length, floated in at middle stump, steps out and smothers the turn. Uses his wrists to push it to mid-on and steal a single
too easy. Backs away and gets a short ball at off stump for his efforts. So much room, so much time. Cuts it between point and short third man
good length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket's left off the front foot
dropped short on middle stump this time, and Gunathilaka doesn't even think of just poking this around the corner. Swivels and pulls this over the leg umpire
short at off stump, looks to punch through the off side, ball skids through too quickly
full at leg stump, pushed midwicket
full at leg stump, defended to midwicket off the front foot
full at middle stump, defended off the front foot
good length at off stump, beats him in flight and draws the leading edge...but point lets the through him and it's two
full at off stump, defended back down the pitch
back of a length at middle stump, exposes all the stumps to nudge this to short third man's right
back of a length outside off, cut straight to point
good length at middle stump, dropped in front of third man with soft hands and it's another single...Raza screams in agony
back of a length down leg side. Moor doesn't gather
this is pushed through fast, but it is too short. Quickly on the back foot, another pull shot powered to the square leg boundary
tossed up at leg stump, driven to long-on
backs away to make room, gets followed with a full ball, drives it to long-on
arm ball, good length at middle stump. Looks to push this through third man and gets half a bat on it
good length at middle stump, looks to glance this, takes it on the pads
back of a length at leg stump, pushed past midwicket off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump, backs away, cuts to sweeper cover
short and wide, another cut to sweeper cover
good length at off stump, defended into the off side off the front foot
full at middle stump, easily nudged to mid-on's left
short, wide, cut to sweeper
good length at middle stump, defended off the front foot
good length on the pads, tickled to deep square leg
good length on off stump, makes room and drives on the up to long-off
good length at middle stump, goes on the back foot and tucks it to deep square
full on the toes, flicked to deep square
back of a length at middle stump, punched to extra cover even as this keeps low and hurries him
good length, skids in from middle stump and hits the pad, outside leg
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
good length at off stump, pushed through point on the up
full at leg stump, driven straight to midwicket
short ball on middle stump, looks to pull, gets an inside edge onto back thigh
good length, pitches outside leg, doesn't turn
overpitched on off stump, squeezed out to long-off
dropped short at middle stump and he backs away, oh so much, shows all his stumps and is nearly falling into the leg side, all to punch this past extra cover. Does so with some power
full outside off stump, driven to extra cover
back of a length, turns back in sharply as he looks to play a late cut, glove and into the crease
oh dear. Short, leg stump. Short fine is really fine and he swivels to pull this past him
short outside off stump, chops it late to backward point
length at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler...who fields and unleashes a throw at the stumps
good length outside off, steps out and drives straight to extra cover. Doesn't get a good connection on this
good length on leg stump, looks to sweep this fine, can't hit it
losing the plot here, the bowling side. Short fine and short backward square leg in place - he drops it short on leg stump. Dickwella swivels and lifts the pull over them
good length on middle stump, defended back down the pitch
full at off stump, jumps down the track to make it a full toss, punches to long-off
back of a length outside off stump, pokes it to short third man with the turn
good length at off stump, pushed straight to midwicket off the back foot
tossed up at off stump. Looks to paddle this fine, checks his shot and taps it to midwicket
good length outside off stump, nudges it to backward point on the up
back of a length outside off, slides straight through and past the outside edge as he looks to play the late cut
short outside off stump, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
good length at middle stump, forward defence
short on middle stump, leaps back in the crease, punches to sweeper cover
full at leg stump, defended into the off side
good length, pushed flat down leg side, looks to nudge it fine, gets it off his pad
good length at off stump, gets to the pitch and looks to go inside-out. Toe-ends it to long-off
close but he's hit that. Too full for a sweep, but he goes at it, trying to drag it from off stump. Just about gets bat. Can't get it past short fine
good length on middle stump, and he'll always take on the sweep. Middles it and induces the dive from deep square, but it's too quick
good length outside off stump, pushes it through the covers on the up
back of a length, spins in sharply, bounces steeply and hits him on the forearm as he looks to run it through third man
good length on middle stump, pushed past midwicket off the back foot

good length outside off stump, leans in, flicks to long-on with the turn...and they're celebrating in the middle, the two batsmen. Hugs and helmets off and all of that. Thinks he's got his 100, he hasn't.
good length on the pads, pushed behind square off the front foot
short on off stump, cut on the bounce to short third man
back of a length at off stump, punched to long-on off the back foot

good length on the pads, waits for it and pushes it to midwicket and this time it is his hundred. Scampers through, takes his helmet off...and drops his bat. Not like a mic drop, more of a geeky fumble. He hasn't got this celebration part right, but the batting has been outstanding.
back of a length outside off stump, cut behind square
tossed up at off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length outside off stump, chopped to short third man
good length at leg stump, pushed to midwicket off the front foot
superb. Full flow of the bat, full face of it, lifts it over mid-off. This was tossed up nicely on off stump, and the bat came down so sweetly
back of a length at middle stump, punched straight to midwicket off the back foot
and finally, gets a late cut right. This is sliding away from off stump and is short. Opens the face, kisses it with the face of the bat and now he's in the nineties
good length at leg stump, pushed to short fine on the up
full on leg stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
full at off stump, steps down the track and pushes it back to the bowler
back of a length on middle stump, looks to force it through the off side off the back foot and finds extra cover
short on middle stump, cuts it to sweeper cover
full at middle stump, defended back to the bowler
dropped short on middle stump, front leg out of the way, swats across the line and finds the midwicket boundary with ease
tossed up at leg stump, driven to long-on
shortish, on and around off stump, dabs to backward point

and maiden hundred for Gunathilaka as well! This is the ODI out of both these openers' dreams! Flat pitch. Flatter attack. Short balls available by the dozen and this one - from a new bowler - is dispatched to the deep square leg boundary
back of a length and outside leg, he is backing away, looking to open up the off side, but Mire follows him, cramps him up
another pull shot, swivelling on the back foot and nailing the gaps at will. Zimbabwe are wilting. A target of 300-plus is well under 100 now with all 10 wickets in hand to chase them
goes for the pull again, but this is a slower short ball. Gunathilaka gloves it down to long leg
back of a length on leg stump, defends. That's drinks.
spots the batsman rushing him and so bowls flat and into the pads, Dickwella responds with a clip to square leg
drifts down the leg side, Dickwella pulls out the sweep, intending to loft it over short fine leg. Misses
tosses it up on leg stump, drives to long-on

thwack! Through extra cover, backing away to take advantage of a short ball in line with the stumps. On this low pitch, against spinners constantly pitching it short, that shot has been particularly useful for both batsmen
goes for the pull, but he is a bit too eager to get the shot away, perhaps bemused by Waller's bowling consistently flat and short. Inside edge onto pad

premeditates the reverse sweep, allowing Waller to adjust. The ball becomes quicker, and fuller to prevent swinging room for Dickwella. He misses, so does the keeper. Moor's had a pretty average match

oh, he's swept it to backward square leg! Waller's done it for Zimbabwe - after 37 overs, and 229 runs, they have their first wicket in this game. Dickwella goes, execution failing him for the shot was on, with the fielders inside the circle
covers the stumps and deflects a good length ball away towards short fine leg

falls short of the long leg fielder running in - Chibhabha the substitute - and it bounces right over that fielder. Could easily have gone to the boundary if not for Mire's alertness from deep square leg
hammers it over deep square leg! Hits with the wind and that ensures the ball clears the backpedalling Mire at dee square leg

dropped by Mumba at long-on. Gunathilaka is either tiring, or he's had enough of this match lasting so long. Looking to hit everything out of the park. This time he picks long-on - but he gives him a life. Played a smashing innings though - his pull shots were just mouth-watering

chops it on! What a weird few minutes of play! This is a good length ball - nothing too difficult about it - and yet Gunathilaka acts as he's been struck dumb. Just lets it come on. Chops it timidly and it deflects onto the stumps
goes for the pull against a slightly shortish delivery on off stump. Finds midwicket
tosses it up on off stump, Mendis nudges it to short midwicket
backs away and punches on top of the bounce to long-on
gets leg side of the flighted ball on off stump and drives to cover
pushes a full delivery on leg stump to mid-on and find a single. Zimbabwe need to do better.
lovely work with the wrists means a ball tossed up outside off settles down in deep square leg, where, as we all know, the white picket fences are
stays back to a good length ball on off stump, and blocks

oh, beautiful. Little lap sweep goes past short fine leg's left. Tharanga spots the fielder being too square and so premeditates the shot. Williams provides the length to get under, even if he lined it outside off Tharanga's touch makes sure he wins
sets up for a rasping square cut, but seeing the ball turn, so very slowly off the pitch, he adjusts into a late cut. His footwork - jumping back in the crease - made the shot possible
heaves a short ball over to deep midwicket
comes forward to block a flighted delivery on off stump
some turn off the pitch and it foils Mendis' attempt to pull. He has to, instead, dab to point
defends a good length ball on off stump
shot ball, but it's so slow that Tharanga has finished pulling the ball before it arrives and hits his thigh
another flatter delivery, angled into the pads, meaning to deny Tharanga hitting room. Batsman sets up for the pull and misses

direct hit at the keeper's end, and Tharanga might be in trouble - ah, but replays show he's safe. What are you doing Sri Lanka? Your batsman plays a fine shot, and then he panics, trying to take a single despite hitting straight to the cover fielder. Raza hits the target, but not quickly enough
fuller delivery on leg stump, pushes to long-on
loads up a tennis forehand against a short and wide delivery and he nearly takes out the bowler
tosses it up on leg stump, clips it to deep midwicket to bring up the 250

there's a man there... there's a man there... Mireeee, but it beats him on his left. Sensational connection from Tharanga. Went down to sweep, and he times it so well - it was nothing more than a whip of the wrists - that it carries to the rope. Hits it on the full.
steps out of his crease, is deceived by the ball dipping on him, and the ball skews off the outside half of the bat to deep cover
slams a short delivery through to the sweeper cover
hangs back, without actually moving back, as he slices the ball from the stumps to the sweeper. Mendis hustles through for a second. Good work
tosses it up outside off, Mendis drives to long-on

launches the short ball - there have been so so many from the Zimbabwe spinners - and Tharanga hammers it over deep midwicket quite handsomely. He's usually pristine on the off side, but here he's looking pretty good slogging too
flicks it, with the turn, through to deep midwicket
catch it, is the cry, and Chiabhabha, the substitute, leaps up as high as he can, but does so a touch late as he moves to his right. dropped. So a tame chip from Tharanga becomes a single in the end

dropped again by Chibhabha, but again, it is another difficult grab! Mendis pulls this short ball mightily, and he has to move to his right again, extending his hand out, but can only parry it away to the deep
sends it through to the sweeper
another pull from Mendis, and it goes rather close to Chibhabha at short midwicket again. Too quick, and too far for him to bother with it though. And it beats long-on on his right too
clips a good length ball through to deep midwicket for a second. Big ground, soft hands, easily done
shifts back and deftly turns the shortish delivery to deep square leg
he's inside edged a pull straight onto his left boot, and it stings! Hobbles around in his crease before flashing an embarrassed little grin and collecting a fist bump from his partner
takes on the short ball again and this time makes a little more out of it - single to deep square leg
a slower, short delivery outside off, Tharanga pulls it to deep midwicket
full and very very wide outside off. The batsman doesn't need to care for them
shortish and outside off, Tharanga hits it off the bottom of the bat back down the pitch
slices the full delivery outside off to deep point
cuts from the stumps, with Raza bowling flat. Single to the sweeper
rocks back, picking the length early, or predicting it with Zimbabwe constantly bowling short, and the pull shot goes to long leg to bring up the fifty stand
flatter delivery, keeps low on off stump, and Tharanga, who's weight is going back and away on leg stump, just about toe-ends it
races down the pitch and nails a straight drive. Raza does well to move to his left and get two hands on it. But it has so much power that it pings away
waits in his load-up and then delivers - guess what? - another short ball. Tharanga isn't fooled by such theatrics. Smacks a cut shot through extra cover
that's ridiculously easy, he made it look ridiculously easy. Out comes a short ball, well outside off, and Mendis greets it with the gentlest little ramp to the third man boundary

offcutter on off stump, defends. And again, Mumba falls in his followthrough, tripping over his right leg. He keeps doing that because he runs in at an angle into the wickets, and then has to change direction immediately to avoid the danger area.
back of a length and outside off, pushes it to the right of the sweeper cover
shortish, and slow, on off stump, Mendis pulls to deep square leg and Sri Lanka have their 300. The last fifty coming in only 28 balls
launches a short ball to deep midwicket
meets the short ball under his eyes and pulls it to deep midwicket.
shortish and outside off, sent away to the sweeper
guides a shortish delivery to point
allows a short ball to stroll away over his right shoulder and become a wide
ducks under the short ball from around the wicket
hits into the breeze, and so the ball just holds up in the air, and plop on the ground about two-thirds of the way to the midwicket boundary
avoids the attempted bouncer on leg stump
continues digging into his own half, Tharanga continues to let them all go, and it's been called a wide for height
slower short ball on off stump, pulls it to deep midwicket
back of a length ball, lets it go.

there it is. Only the second chase of 300 ever in Sri Lanka and both have come in this series. Tharanga wraps it up with a pull - indicative of the lengths Zimbabwe have insisted on bowling on this flat pitch, those tactics need to be looked at - and stays not out for the third innings in a row
